subject: Good day,
body:
Good day,
This is a repeat of my previous unanswered letter. I am Mr. Boris
Danilovich, investor and director of a major
oil company in Russia. Given the current economic sanctions that some
European countries and the United
States of America have imposed on Russia are having a significant
impact on citizens. I am asking for your
assistance in raising and investing the sum of Nine Million Five
hundred Thousand United States Dollars
deposited in a financial institution in Canada on my behalf.
These funds may be placed in any of your designated accounts for
investment purposes and also to avoid
confiscation by the US Government.
Please reply for more details.
Private email to contact:- ( 
alphadecision9@gmail.com
 )
Mr. Boris Danilovich
*************************************************************************************************************
Please do not doubt this letter or dismiss it as Spam, as I am ready
to give you attention.

subject: Re:   Good day,
body:
Hello Mr. Boris Danilovich,

I hope this message finds you well. Your letter certainly piqued my interest, especially the part about investing such a large sum of money. I must admit, I'm not very familiar with the intricacies of international finance and economic sanctions.

Could you please elaborate more on how exactly this process would work? And what kind of investments are we talking about here? 

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Shirley

subject: Hello Mrs Shirley,
body:
Hello Mrs Shirley,

Thank you for responding from my extended hand of cordial and mutually
benefited investment inquest. I know that the email must have come to
you as a surprise, but I believe that it takes just a moment/contact
for people to meet and become great friends and business partners.This
is a personal and private email directed to you, and I request that it
be treated as such.


I know the rest of the world is praying for the Ukrainian people ,but
the world does not support Russia's invasion on Ukraine. In relation
to my proposition to you ,the funds are presently in off-shore bank
account with a Canadian bank, my decision to want to move my funds
from Toronto- Canada was a result of information gathered from my
contact person in the bank that Canadian government intend to freeze
funds belonging to Russia citizens in Canada due to the Russian
invasion on Ukraine.

On this advise that I have reached out to you by mail and I am 100%
optimistic that the process by which legal documents will take effect
in your name will not be more than 8 officials working days as soon as
you forward your contact information, there are no form of risk
involved all I need from you is full contact information that would be
used to prepare application letter of request to have the investment
funds be released to you. .
I would also want to read from you on what blue chips investment place
you intend to invest the funds in your country ,

I will offer 35% from the sum of $9,500,000.00 dollars to help me
receive funds also to advise me on any good investment places of your
choice as the fund will first arrive to you ,we shall arrange
agreement letter to bind us in one accord to further proceed with the
transaction. I implore you to keep this transaction very confidential
to yourself only, I believe with your cooperation and collaboration we
must actualize our Objectives.

More information will be conveyed to you as soon as I receive your
response. I will also send a copy of my identity for your view. Upon
your confirmation.

I await your response on receiving your positive reply to this email,
I will prepare a Letter of Claim that you shall email to the holding
bank to formally notify them of your intent to claim the funds in the
capacity of a partnership.

I am looking forward to hearing from you.

Kind regards,

Mr. Boris Danilovich

subject: Re: Hello Mrs Shirley,
body:
Hello Mr. Boris Danilovich,

Thank you for reaching out to me with such an interesting proposition. I must say, it's not every day that one receives an email like this! 

I'm sorry to hear about the situation in Ukraine and the potential impact on your funds in Canada. It's a complex world we live in, isn't it? 

As for your proposal, I'm intrigued but I do have a few questions if you don't mind. You mentioned legal documents - could you elaborate more on what these would entail? Also, how exactly would the process of transferring the funds work?

Regarding investment opportunities, I'm not an expert by any means but I'd be happy to share some ideas once we've clarified the details of your proposal.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Shirley

subject: Hello Mrs Shirley,
body:
Hello Mrs Shirley,

Thank you for your email, have read your well detailed message which
has completely explained all that i want to know,i want you to look
around or make research good investment place or any where you can put
the funds to generate profit for us.I want you to receive and invest
these funds in the investment venture you can handle as a professional
.

Therefore to enable us to proceed properly in this transaction I have
prepared and attached a letter of claim as stated in my last email for
you to fax or email to the bank immediately. It is very important you
check your email regularly because this is the medium for our
communication for now please. I am so happy that I can trust you and
have hope in you. I haven't met you before but my spirit is telling me
that I should trust you and work with you. I pray this trust remains
with us. I want to reassure you that there is absolutely no risk
involved. I also want you to assure me that I will have access to my
fund when funds are in your possession?

You are making the bank understand that you have these documents that
show that your partner who happened to be their customer deposited
these funds with them and that you are willing at this time to put up
a claim to repatriate the funds to your nominated bank account. The
most important factor is that you are able to produce the said
documents should they request that you do so.

Once again, rest assured that this deal is safe and risk free. One
thing is to find a friend, another is to find a friend in need. I am
convinced that you are a responsible, mature and trustworthy person.
That alone has given me the confidence that we are going to achieve
this. Below is the 'Letter of Claim' which you should complete and
send it immediately to the Foreign Remittances Unit on this Fax
number: +1-518 483 8808 or directly to the Senior Account Manager Mrs.
Judith Walker on her eMAIL address  judith.walker@bnk-mail.online

Please, note that at any time you receive any correspondence from
them, the very first thing you must do is to notify me. On no account
should you communicate with the bank without first informing me. This
is in order not to make any mistakes that could create hitches thereby
complicating issues.

Will await your swift response when you have contacted the bank.
Kind regards,
Mr. Boris Danilovich
xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
Senior Account Manager,
Foreign Remittances Desk,
Northern Credit Union.
Toronto-Canada
...............................................
Fill your information below

Full name:........................
Country:..........................
Date of Birth....................
Telephone:......................
Profession:......................

 Dear Sir,



     Re: Letter of Claim
My Name is…........ I am a partner of your sick Customer, Mr.Boris
Danilovich. During a recent search of our archive, I discovered
documents that show he had a fixed deposit account in the sum of $9.5
Million US Dollars with your custody. I am hereby addressing this
letter to you as a formal notice of claim of the above-mentioned
deposit in the capacity of partnership.

I look forward to hearing from you.

Yours sincerely

........................
Your Name

subject: Mrs Shirley,
body:
Mrs Shirley,

Good day and happy Valentines day,having detailed area of
collaboration i had wanted you to participate am now wondering there
have not been news from you? There are no form of risk involved in the
transaction,if you want the funds be transferred into your bank
account bit by bit the Canada bank will work with your advise on that.

Time is of essence towards the conclusion of the transaction therefore
i would advise that you contact the bank in Canada through its email
contact address included in the previous letter that i have sent to
you.

I would appreciate your attendance to this letter.

Mr Boris Danilovich

subject: Re: Mrs Shirley,
body:
Hello Mr. Boris Danilovich,

I hope this message finds you well. I appreciate your prompt response and the information provided.

I'm a bit curious about the process you mentioned. Could you please elaborate more on how the funds will be transferred into my bank account bit by bit? Also, could you provide more details about how the Canada bank will work with my advise?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Shirley

subject: Hello Mrs Shirley,
body:
Hello Mrs Shirley,

Thank you very much for the response to my letter.Happy Valentine day
to you.I have read and understood your question about proposed
investment proposition.

I want to add that from the moment you send the application letter of
claim through the bank email contact address of Mrs Judith Walker,the
bank resumes communication with you ,being that i have implored your
service to help me receive and invest the funds wisely due to the
political instability in my country.

The bank would transfer the funds bit by bit into your designated bank
account after the documents must have been clarified that said funds
bears my name as the rightful beneficiary of fund before appointing
you to represent me as the next of Kin to receive the fund on my
behalf.

The said documents will be needed by you to process the release of
fund into your bank account are presently intact in my position,so
there is no cause for alarm ,i will provide these documents to you on
demand by the bank.

Having effect changes of fund ownership to your name,its your legal
right to tell the Canada bank how you want the transfer being done
,the bank will follow your instruction to release the fund into your
bank account.


Mr Boris Danilovich

subject: Re: Hello Mrs Shirley,
body:
Hello Mr. Boris Danilovich,

Thank you for your detailed explanation about the investment process. It sounds like a very organized and systematic approach.

I'm curious, how does the bank ensure that the funds are transferred securely? And what kind of investments do you think would be wise to consider with these funds?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Shirley

subject: Hello Mrs Shirley,
body:
Hello Mrs Shirley,

Thank you very much for the response,real estate venture and stock
would be profitable,i don't make decision for you ,its better you look
around and see if there is any investment place suitable that you can
invest the funds.

The bank will secure the funds and have them be transferred into your
bank account bit by bit .I am 100% optimistic that there is no risk
you will encounter.

Mr. Boris Danilovich,

subject: Re: Hello Mrs Shirley,
body:
Hello Mr. Boris,

Thank you for your response and the information about the estate venture and stock. It's really interesting to hear about these opportunities. I'm not very familiar with this kind of investment, could you perhaps explain a bit more about how it works? 

Also, when you mention that the bank will secure the funds and have them transferred into my account bit by bit, how exactly does that process work? Is there a specific timeline or schedule for these transfers?

I'm just trying to understand everything better before making any decisions. Thank you again for your time and assistance.

Best wishes,
Shirley

subject: Re: Hello Mrs Shirley,
body:
Mrs Shirley,
Thank you very much for the response and question contained ,to invest fund
in real estate venture is buy hotel apartment ,shopping malls rentals,
there are some other venture on this platform if you look around in your
city


The bank resume full legal with financial responsibility from the moment
you forward the application letter of claim which i advise you should send
to the bank. The bank will verify the legal documents which i will provide
to you before releasing the said  fund to you.

If you could forward the application letter of claim to the bank the
duration to process and complete process that allows fund hit your bank
account will not be more than two official banking days.

I quite appreciate for properly taken your time to clarify information
about the transaction before venturing into it, but i would advise that you
send the application letter of claim to the bank for recognition that you
have been mandated by Mr Boris Danilovich to represent him receive the
investment fund.

Mr Boris Danilovich

subject: Re: Hello Mrs Shirley,
body:
Hello Mr. Boris Danilovich,

Thank you for your detailed response. It's quite interesting to learn about the potential investment opportunities in real estate, especially in hotel apartments and malls rentals.

I'm curious about the process of forwarding the letter of claim to the bank. Could you please elaborate more on this? What exactly does this letter need to contain? And how does it help in verifying the legal documents?

Also, you mentioned that it would take no more than two official banking days for the funds to hit my bank account once I forward the letter of claim. That seems pretty quick! How is this possible?

Lastly, I'd like to know more about Mr. Boris Danilovich's role in all of this. You mentioned that he has mandated me to represent him - could you tell me more about what this entails?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Shirley

subject: Re: Hello Mrs Shirley,
body:
Hello Mr. Boris Danilovich,

Thank you for your detailed response. It's quite interesting to learn about the potential investment opportunities in real estate, such as hotel apartments and malls rentals. I must admit, it sounds like a promising venture.

I'm curious about the process of forwarding the letter of claim to the bank. Could you please elaborate more on this? What exactly does this letter need to contain? And how does the bank verify these legal documents?

Also, you mentioned that the process will not take more than two official banking days. Is this a standard duration or could it vary depending on certain factors?

Lastly, I would like to understand more about Mr. Boris Danilovich's role in all of this. How exactly am I representing him in receiving the investment fund?

Looking forward to your response.

Best wishes,
Shirley

subject: Re: Hello Mrs Shirley,
body:
Mrs Shirley,

Thank you very much for your information the application letter of claim
that you will send to the bank will contain your full name with a contact
address. The bank will verify my legal documents which i will send to you
through its verification department and clarify if they are satisfied with
availability of the documents provided or not

I am very sorry i made a mistake its two weeks not two days to conclude the
transaction with the bank.

The moment you send the application letter of claim to the bank process
commence, my role is to receive information from you when you hear from the
bank and i will give you more advise on how to proceed with the bank, i
cannot receive or send money out from Russia for this reason that i have
proposed to you.

Mr Boris Danilovich

subject: Re: Hello Mrs Shirley,
body:
Hello Mrs Shirley,

Thank you so much for your message. I'm really excited about this opportunity and I appreciate your trust in me.

I understand that the letter of claim will contain my full name and contact address, which the bank will verify against the legal documents you'll send to them. It's good to know that they'll be thorough in their verification process.

Oh, it's okay about the mistake regarding the timeline. Two weeks sounds more reasonable than two days to conclude things with the bank.

So, once I send the letter of claim to the bank, the process will commence. Your role then is to advise me when I hear from the bank. That sounds like a good plan!

Just out of curiosity, why can't you receive or send money out from Russia? Is it due to some kind of regulation?

Best wishes,
Shirley

subject: Re: Hello Mrs Shirley,
body:
Hello Mr. Boris Danilovich,

Thank you for your detailed message. I must say, it's quite an interesting proposition you've put forth. I'm not very familiar with these types of transactions, but I'm willing to learn more about it.

You mentioned a letter of claim that needs to be sent to the bank. Could you please explain more about this process? What kind of information does the bank usually require in such letters?

Also, you mentioned some documents that show a deposit was made by your partner. Could you tell me more about these documents? What do they look like and what kind of information do they contain?

I appreciate your trust in me and I assure you that I will handle this matter with utmost care and confidentiality.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Shirley

subject: Hello Mrs Shirley,
body:
Hello Mrs Shirley,

The reason that i cannot send out money from Russia or receive huge
amount is due to the global sanction on Russia ,my contact with the
Canada bank informed about the need to move out my family investment
fund to a safer place,please send the application letter of claim as
you forward to the bank .

Mr Boris Danilovich

subject: Re: Hello Mrs Shirley,
body:
Hello Mr. Boris Danilovich,

Thank you for your message. I'm sorry to hear about the difficulties you're facing due to the global sanctions on Russia. It must be a challenging situation.

I'm curious, how did you come across my contact information? Also, could you please provide more details about this family investment fund that you mentioned? I'd like to understand better before we proceed further.

Remember, I am here to help in any way I can but without compromising my personal safety and security. Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Shirley

subject: Hello Mrs Shirley,
body:
Hello Mrs Shirley,

Good morning ,sorry i did not receive the letter early enough your
message ended up in the SPAM folder of my email account,i got your
email contact from the web directory when i was searching for a
reliable person.

The family fund accrued from sale of crude oil being the eldest son i
was mandated to take on the responsibility to look for someone who
will help us receive the investment money in oversea.

Mr Boris DAnilovich

Mr. Boris Danilovich,

subject: Re: Hello Mrs Shirley,
body:
Hello Mr. Boris,

Good day to you! I'm glad to hear from you, although it's a bit surprising that my email ended up in your SPAM folder. I'm curious about how you found my contact information in the web directory.

Your message is quite intriguing. It sounds like you're dealing with a significant responsibility as the eldest son. Could you please share more details about this investment money and how I might be able to assist?

Remember, I am not able to provide any personal information over email for security reasons.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Shirley

subject: Re: Hello Mrs Shirley,
body:
Hello Mr. Boris,

Good day to you! I'm glad to hear from you, although it's a bit surprising that your message ended up in my SPAM folder. It's interesting how technology works sometimes, isn't it?

I'm intrigued by your situation and would like to understand more about it. Could you please elaborate on the nature of this investment? Also, could you tell me more about how you found my contact information? I'm always curious about how these connections are made.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

P.S: Please remember that while I am interested in helping, I won't be able to share any personal information for security reasons.

Best wishes,
Shirley
